The `dart:ui` import is prefixed with `ui`, so the link may need to be `[ui.Window.defaultRouteName]` to actually work. Or perhaps it should point to the `ui.window` variable instead of the `ui.Window` class?
I've added an import of Window to this file for the docs.
Don't we need to check `mounted` here too?

Here's the way I understand didPopRoute's role in all of this.

If didPopRoute() returns true it just means that the pop request has been dealt with. In this case willPop() defeats the request, i.e. it's been dealt with, even if the route was disposed.
You can also remove this one.

if _locale was `ui.window.locale ?? widget.locale` you could avoid rebuilding the app when an app with a fixed locale experienced a system-level locale change.

Not a big optimisation on the grand scale of things, i'll grant you.
did you not like this suggestion? (that's fine, just curious if you missed it or dismissed it)
i guess it would mean having to have a didUpdateWidget method and so on, which isn't great
We should do this in Locale itself, see my comment in https://github.com/flutter/flutter/issues/11907.
OK, I'll take care of that in a separate PR, after updating the Locale class.

I think that might mask an error as much as provide a feature that wouldn't be used very often.
Fair enough. Document that you can't return null in the various places?
OK, I've added a "must not return null" warning in the various places.
same nit: feel free to use `///` and proper links, e.g. `[WidgetsLocalizations.delegate]`.

This property has a default value so its set by default. Is that what we want?
Yes - we want to make sure it's not null (if empty, just an empty map).  that's from existing code in `MaterialApp`
I was trying to square the property with the doc `If this property is set, the [pageRouteBuilder] property must also be set`. The constructor doesn't require pageRouteBuilder to be set.
Updated the doc to "If the routes map is not empty..." in b82e038
Should a similar change be made in `widgets/binding.dart`?
I dont think it directly accesses locale properties and mostly just uses == comparison over the whole locale, or calls the _resolveLocale() so might not be necessary.
when will it be null and when will it be empty? the comment only mentions being null (and refers to the old name)
Note that I just discovered https://github.com/dart-lang/dartdoc/issues/1812 (our templates are not showing up in the docs for the base classes)
from the docs it's unclear to me how this one is different from LocaleListResolutionCallback? Both should probably have a "See also" section that link to each other and explain the difference.
How do I decide if I should provide a localeListResolutionCallback or localeResolutionCallback or both? We should document that in an obvious place.

This is here primarily for backwards compatibility. If an existing algorithm matches on just the top locale, use the legacy `localeResolutionCallback`. Otherwise, use the list callback that supports the full preferred locale list. I can document that the localeListResolutionCallback is preferred for new implementations. `localeListResolutionCallback` can do everything `localeResolutionCallback` can do.

I'm not sure if it makes sense to put the emphasis in this message on pageRouteBuilder.  I feel like this could prod somebody in the wrong direction if they actually need builder, or onGenerateRoute.  Is it sufficient to just say "builder, onGenerateRoute, or pageRouteBuilder must be specified."? (Although I guess that pretty much just restates the assert expression)

There are other asserts covering various scenarios around needing a builder vs home/routes/onGenerateRoute/etc.  This one in particular will fire after those, and at this point should only fire for someone who has specified `home` or `routes` but not `builder`, `onGenerateRoute`, or `pageRouteBuilder`.
Awesome!  Thanks for the quick reply.

comments.body: It looks like this assert doesn't allow just specifying `home`.

That doesn't work currently (before this change).  If you specify `home`, you have to specify how to do transitions in case there are multiple routes.  Working on updating the docs for that.  

I suppose we could special case just have a home and no other routes, or having a routes list that only contains home (so not ransitions will be required)?

For the sake of this PR, I guess we should leave things as they are. 

A separate PR, that relaxes the constraints on WidgetsApp's parameters, would be useful.

         builder != null ||
         onGenerateRoute != null ||
         pageRouteBuilder != null,

comments.body: `pageRouteBuilder`

'hero animation' is specifically the page's inner content that's wrapped in a `Hero` that flies above the page transition. Here, the MaterialApp is providing a pageRouteBuilder that creates a Material compliant page transition rather than hero animations. MaterialApp also makes sure the hero animation is Material compliant, but that's via the createRectTween in the HeroController rather than via pageRouteBuilder
So the pageRouteBuilder is actually creating a MaterialPage, which uses those animations - do you want this to be clarified here?

Depends what you mean by 'those animations'. pageRouteBuilder and MaterialPageRoute etc are mostly orthogonal to hero animations. Their page transition animations drive the hero animations but they don't define the hero animations.

This is a bit unclear. You just said `If [home] or [routes] are not null, then either the [pageRoutebuilder] or the [builder] parameter is required` and here you're saying it's optional in all cases. I think you meant it can be additionally provided in all cases or some such.
Inclusive or.. I'll try to clarify.
https://github.com/flutter/flutter/pull/24090
